segments.text: I notice the woman standing in the water, and it’s like she’s in her own world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are taking cookies, and it’s sad that she doesn’t even notice them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is reaching so hard, and it’s like he’s desperate for that cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting, and it’s almost heartbreaking how patient she is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is overflowing, and it’s like no one cares.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel bad for the woman, so focused on her task that she misses everything else.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene feels lonely, like everyone is in their own little bubble.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The outside garden looks so peaceful, but inside, it’s all chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if anyone will ever notice what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s all just a little too quiet and disconnected.
segments.speaker: PAR
